io.cere.rewards_module

Class RewardsModule

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.cere.rewards_module.RewardsModule

  • public class RewardsModule
extends Object
    This is the main class which incapsulates all logic (opening/closing activity etc) and provides high-level methods to manipulate with.

    Almost all methods of this class supports "method chaining".

    All you need to start working with the class is to instantiate RewardsModule once and initialize it with few required params. Example: 

             
              RewardsModule rewardsModule = new RewardsModule(context);
              rewardsModule.init("YOUR_APP_ID");

    That's enough for start loading RewardsModule, but note that RewardsModule still remains hidden. Also, first load of RewardsModule takes a some time which depends on network connection quality. That's why you need to init RewardsModule as soon as possible. Next initializations after opening app again will be faster because of caching.

    If you want to show RewardsModule right after it has initialized, you can add listener RewardsModule.OnInitializationHandler implementation which will invoke method show on RewardsModule instance. Example: 

             
              rewardsModule.onInitializationFinished(() -> {
                  rewardsModule.show("YOUR_PLACEMENT");
              });

    But the most common way is assigning OnClickListener to some View. Example:

             
              button.setOnClickListener(view -> {
                  rewardsModule.show("YOUR_PLACEMENT");
              });

    Author:
    Mikhail Chachkouski Also see another callbacks you can provide to RewardsModule:
    See Also:
    RewardsModule.OnSignInHandler, RewardsModule.OnSignUpHandler, RewardsModule.OnGetClaimedRewardsHandler, RewardsModule.OnGetUserByEmailHandler, RewardsModule.OnInitializationHandler

      • setUsername

        public RewardsModule setUsername(String value)
        Sends username (email or phone number) to RewardsModule field on SignUp/SignIn pages. For example, you know user email and don't want to let user enter his email again. So, you can do that for user by invoking this method.
        Parameters:
        value - The field value.
        Returns:
        current instance of RewardsModule.
